newsitem.title: NEW ZEALAND: S&P says CCA rating outlook negative.
newsitem.headline: S&P says CCA rating outlook negative.

text.p: Standard and Poor's on Thursday affirmed its AA minus long-term corporate credit rating on Coca-Cola Amatil Ltd (CCA), but said the ratings outlook was negative.
At the same time, S&P said it had assigned its AA minus rating to Coca-Cola Amatil's five-year US$300 million Eurobond issue, maturing on May 28, 2002.

"The negative outlook on CCA reflects the strained creditor protection measures for the Coke system, resulting from more than US$2.8 billion of debt-financed acquisitions announced in mid-1996 by Coca-Cola Enterprises Inc., the largest Coke bottler
S&P said the ratings reflected CCA's strong operational link with US-based major shareholder The Coca-Cola Company ("Coke", rated AA/Negative/A-1+).
They also reflected stable cash flow generation, which was supported by CCA's leading market position in diverse franchise territories and strong brand name.
"These factors are offset by CCA's higher exposure in less-developed offshore markets as well as heightened competition," S&P said.

CCA is Coke's second largest anchor bottler and will be the largest bottler outside the U.S. following CCA's recent proposed A$3.4 billion acquisition of Coca-Cola Bottling Philippines Inc. from San Miguel Corp, S&P said.
CCA has operations throughout Australasia, Indonesia and Europe. -- Wellington Newsroom (64 4) 4734746
